attributes.action: To make Brighton and Hove buses to review there price of bus fare
attributes.additional_details: Having worked in adult services in Newhaven and Seaford i know a number people don't have have access to a smartphone to be able to purchase a M ticket or internet, I personally don't think a £2 increase on any-fare is acceptable make people aware of your intentions to do this and increase it gradually if you need to but £2 immidaite increase is quite frankly wrong
attributes.background:
Brighton and hove Buses have announced an increase in bus fare, for the people of Seaford/Newhaven/Peacehaven this is a £2 increase on a ticket to Brighton. 
Brighton buses reasoning is they want people to turn digital, they have also changed the zone we fall under hence the huge increase.

rejection.details:
We can't accept your petition because the UK Government and Parliament aren't responsible for the issue you raise. Local councils are responsible for local bus services.

You could raise your issue with a local councillor, who represents you. You can use this page to find out who your local councillors are, and how to contact them:
https://www.gov.uk/find-your-local-councillor

Your local council also has a petitions process - you can find out more about it here: https://www.brighton-hove.gov.uk/content/council-and-democracy/councillors-and-committees/e-petitions
